page.title: 14A Knockholt Character
page.content: Knockholt Village is proud to have as one of its residents Miss Winifred Constable who is a direct descendant of John Constable the famous English artist. She was born and has lived all her life at Stoneings Farm on the top of the Downs. There has been a dwelling on the site since Roman Times. Brampton Manor stood there in the middle ages until completely destroyed by fire in the 18th century when Stoneings Farm was built. It is known that Constable's contemporary, Turner, visited and sketched in Knockholt thus giving this village connections with two of Britain's greatest artists. Miss Constable is well known and loved in the village for her many activities and extensive knowledge of the district and its history. She sang in the church choir for many years.
